CVMX_SHARED cvmx_dfa_app_config_t dfa_config

Detailed Description

Interface to the CN31XX, CN38XX, and CN58XX hardware DFA engine.

Revision
95207

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_LAST_TERMINAL   CVMX_DFA_NODESM_LAST_TERMINAL
#define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_MAX_NODES   CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES
#define CVMX_DFA_NODE18_SIZE   CVMX_DFA_NODESM_SIZE
#define CVMX_DFA_NODE36_SIZE   CVMX_DFA_NODELG_SIZE
#define CVMX_DFA_NODELG_SIZE   1024
#define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_LAST_TERMINAL   (CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES-1)
#define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_MAX_NODES   ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX)) ? 0x8000 : 0x20000)
#define CVMX_DFA_NODESM_SIZE   512
#define CVMX_DFA_STATE_TICKET_BIT_POS   16

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvmx_dfa_graph_type_t

Which type of memory encoding is this graph using.

Make sure you setup the LLM to match.

Enumerator:
CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_SM 
CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_LG 
CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_18b 
CVMX_DFA_GRAPH_TYPE_36b 
enum cvmx_dfa_node_type_t

The possible node types.

Enumerator:
CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_NORMAL 

Node is a branch.

CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_MARKED 

Node is marked special.

CVMX_DFA_NODE_TYPE_TERMINAL 

Node is a terminal leaf.

enum cvmx_dfa_stop_reason_t

The possible reasons the DFA stopped processing.

Enumerator:
CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_DATA_GONE 

DFA ran out of data.

CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_PARITY_ERROR 

DFA encountered a memory error.

CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_FULL 

DFA is full.

CVMX_DFA_STOP_REASON_TERMINAL 

DFA hit a terminal.

Function Documentation

static void __cvmx_dfa_write_command ( cvmx_dfa_command_t *  command  )  [inline, static]

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Write a new command to the DFA. Calls to this function are internally synchronized across all processors, and the doorbell is rung during this function.

Parameters:
command Command to write
void cvmx_dfa_get_fpa_pool_config ( cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t *  dfa_pool  ) 

Gets up the FPA pool data from internal data structure.

Parameters:
dfa_pool pointer to the fpa data structure to copy data
int cvmx_dfa_initialize ( void   ) 

Initialize the DFA hardware before use Returns 0 on success, -1 on failure.

static uint64_t cvmx_dfa_is_done ( cvmx_dfa_result0_t *  result_ptr  )  [inline, static]

Check if a DFA has completed processing.

Parameters:
result_ptr Result area the DFA is using
Returns:
Non zero if the DFA is done

uint64_t  buffer_size,
uint64_t  buffer_count 
)

pool fpa pool number yo use

void cvmx_dfa_shutdown ( void   ) 

Shutdown and cleanup resources used by the DFA.

static void cvmx_dfa_submit ( const cvmx_dfa_graph_t *  graph,
int  start_node,
void *  input,
int  input_length,
int  use_gather,
int  is_little_endian,
cvmx_dfa_result0_t *  result,
int  max_results,
cvmx_wqe_t *  work 
) [inline, static]

Submit work to the DFA units for processing.

Parameters:
graph Graph to process
start_node The node to start (or continue) walking from includes. start_node_id and snrepl (PASS3/CN58XX), but gxor, nxoren, and nreplen are taken from the graph structure
input The input to match against
input_length The length of the input in bytes
use_gather The input and input_length are of a gather list
is_little_endian Set to 1 if the input is in little endian format and must be swapped before compare.
result Location the DFA should put the results in. This must be an area sized in multiples of a cache line.
max_results The maximum number of 64-bit result1 words after result0. That is, "size of the result area in 64-bit words" - 1. max_results must be at least 1.
work Work queue entry to submit when DFA completes. Can be NULL.
static void cvmx_dfa_write_doorbell ( uint64_t  num_commands  )  [inline, static]

Ring the DFA doorbell telling it that new commands are available.

Parameters:
num_commands Number of new commands
static void cvmx_dfa_write_edge_sm ( const cvmx_dfa_graph_t *  graph,
uint64_t  source_node,
uint64_t  match_index,
uint64_t  destination_node0,
uint64_t  destination_node1 
) [inline, static]

Write a small node edge to LLM.

Parameters:
graph Graph to modify
source_node Source node for this edge
match_index Index into the node edge table. This is the match character/2.
destination_node0 Destination if the character matches (match_index*2).
destination_node1 Destination if the character matches (match_index*2+1).
static void cvmx_dfa_write_node_lg ( const cvmx_dfa_graph_t *  graph,
uint64_t  source_node,
unsigned char  match,
uint64_t  destination_node,
cvmx_dfa_node_type_t  destination_type 
) [inline, static]

Write a large node edge to LLM.

Parameters:
graph Graph to modify
source_node Source node for this edge
match Character to match before taking this edge.
destination_node Destination node of the edge.
destination_type Node type at the end of this edge.
